lifecycle.name: PR
lifecycle.overview: Executed after documentation audit is complete. Creates the pull request and closes the beads ticket. All operations including git push and PR creation are delegated to sub-agents — the orchestrator never runs commands directly.

phase.name: PREPARE
phase.actor: Orchestrator launches a PR Drafter agent (reasoning tier)

actions.action: Compile all commits on the feature branch
Review the full diff against main
Draft the PR using the template below

phase.status-message: executing PR/PREPARE on {ticket-id} with pr drafter agent

phase.name: HUMAN_GATE
phase.actor: Orchestrator presents the draft PR to the human
phase.gate: BLOCKED — Do not proceed. Human approval required before continuing.
phase.note: Human may edit the title, body, or testing plan before approving.
phase.status-message: awaiting PR/HUMAN_GATE on {ticket-id} — BLOCKED: human approval required

phase.name: SUBMIT
phase.actor: Orchestrator launches a Submitter agent (light tier)

actions.action: Push the feature branch to remote
Create the PR via "gh pr create"

Close the beads ticket with a close_reason summarizing what was done. TRUNK_BASED: close the single ticket. FEATURE_BRANCHING: close the epic ticket (all child tickets should already be closed during their individual workflow cycles). If any children are still open, flag this to the orchestrator before closing.

After closing the ticket, ensure the beads changes (.beads/ files) are committed on the feature branch before the PR merges. The ticket closure will reach the default branch via the PR merge, and the GitHub Action will close the GitHub Issue at that point. No separate sync protocol is needed.
Report the PR URL back to the orchestrator

phase.status-message: executing PR/SUBMIT on {ticket-id} with submitter agent

phase.name: HANDOFF
phase.description: Ticket complete. PR created and ticket closed. Report PR URL to human.
